run().Description: When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread. The general contract of the method run is that it may take any action whatsoever.

ClassDesc: The base class from which an application should derive in order to receive RS messages from scripts. When a script calls rsSendToClient, the data fields will be filled, and the run method will be called on a separate thread. This will occur some time after rsSendToClient completes in the script, as rsSendToClient is asynchronous. Message handlers are not guaranteed to have completed when @B_android#support#v8#renderscript#RenderScript#finish_E@ returns.
